result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carrie A Larsen

records.addlTxt:
1:19 PM Defendant Carrie A Larsen in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Carrie A Larsen.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Court informs the parties that if the Preliminary Hearing is contested that the parties will need to set this with the assigned Judge on a date other than the Preliminary Hearing dates. 

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 10/24/22 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 3

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal controlled substances. 
Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription or associate with those with controlled substances. 
Do not possess weapons.
Follow open bond conditions for any other case.

1:02 PM Defendant Carrie Ann Larsen appears by video from the Portage County Jail.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.
Atty Mutchler calls the case and states the appearances. 

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) states facts for anticipated charges of Hit and Run, Throwing or Discharging Bodily Fluids at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor, Felony Bail Jumping, Operate While Revoked- Rev Due to Alc/Cont/Subst/Refusal, Resisting or Obstructing Officer, OWI- 3rd Offense. 

Court questions case 22CF325 as it related to the defendant.

Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record. 

Court confirms addressed as stated in case 22CF325.
Atty Bergner states that the address on that case is accurate. 

BY THE COURT: Initial appearance scheduled.
$1,500 cash bond set.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
